value.title: Hex Tile, DAX and narratives - Roundup #44
value.excerpt: Jason Thomas looks at how to create a Hex Tile Grid Map in Power BI. Bill Anton looks at how you can use DAX to accomplish a logical AND. Chris Webb uses DAX to create dynamic chart titles in Power BI. And, a new Power BI custom visual is available for natural language narratives.  Hex Tile Grid Maps

value.title: Roundup #30 (Service update, DAX in Report Builder, export and more)

value.title: Age Banding in Power BI Using TREATAS DAX Function   Relationship Based on Between
value.excerpt: One of the most common types of banding or binning is banding based on a range. Let's say, for example,  you want to have a group of customers based on their age group. The age group banding can be created in Power Query at the data transformation stage. It can be created using the Grouping and Binning

However, sometimes, you just want this to be in DAX way, so here in this blog and video, I explained how to create

value.title: Basics of DAX Expression in Power BI
value.excerpt: There are a lot of resources about how to use each function. However, you always need to start with learning how the expression language works itself. You need to learn how to reference columns, and tables. what operators can be used, and what are the very simple basics of writing a DAX expression. In

value.title: Caution When Using Variables in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: I have written another blog post about variables previously and explained how useful variables are. Variables in DAX are helpful in both readability and also the performance of your code. However, there are scenarios that you have to be careful when you use variables. Because variables are stored, they

value.title: Create a Table with A to Z Character Values in Power BI Using DAX
